div.head: Edition statement and encoding description
div.p: These elements should be provided in the header for texts that we provide an edition for. The editionStmt should specify the origin of the text. The encodingDesc specifies the principles used when encoding, when known (e.g. transcription, specific tag sets, etc.)

div.head: divs edition and textparts
div.p: Text is entered in the body of a TEI file under into a div type='edition' . Each text part should be contained into a div. divs should always be well nested one into the other. These will always take a subtype='textpart' and a subtype with the desired value. There should always be also a n identifying for example chapter 3 as well as a corresp pointing to the appropriate msPart or msItem

div.p: Please be careful in always stating the sources for the description of a work, especially for the division of the work into textparts and other structural decisions. Ideally this source should be an edition, but if none exists, state if the description follows for example the EAe or a manuscript.
Note that after each Gǝʿz word there should be a separator or punctuation without space.

If the text contains verses we will use l as in the example above. lb can also be used to mark linebreaks, for example in Inscriptions. Be careful: ab should be only used in the lowest level div nesting:
